00225 template <class T>
00226 void BinarySearchTree<T>::getNodeValue(const long & searchKey, T & outNode) const
00227 {
00228         nodeType<T> * current;
00229         bool found = false;
00230 
00231         if (this->root == 0)
00232         {
00233                 cout << "Cannot search an empty tree." << endl;
00234         }
00235         else
00236         {
00237                 // Tree is not empty...
00238 
00239                 current = this->root;
00240 
00241                 while(   (current != 0) && !(found)   )
00242                 {
00243                         // Keep searching...
00244 
00245                         // Get the search key for the current item
00246                         T currentItem = current->data;
00247 
00248 
00249                         // Not sure how to enforce that T is required to implement Searchable.
00250 
00251                         long itemKey;
00252                         itemKey = currentItem.getKey(); // gets the ISBN value from the BookType or BookLoan object.
00253 
00254                         // Compare key
00255                         if (itemKey == searchKey)
00256                         {
00257                                 // Found at this node.
00258                                 found = true;
00259                                 outNode = currentItem;
00260                                 return;
00261                         }
00262                         else if (itemKey > searchKey)
00263                         {
00264                                 // Search left subtree
00265                                 current = current->left;
00266                         }
00267                         else
00268                         {
00269                                 // Search right subtree
00270                                 current = current->right;
00271                         }
00272                 }       // end while
00273         }               // end else
00274 }

00291 template <class T>
00292 bool BinarySearchTree<T>::replaceNode(const long & searchKey, const T & nodeData)
00293 {
00294         bool found = false;
00295 
00296         nodeType<T> * current;
00297 
00298 
00299         if (this->root == 0)
00300         {
00301                 cout << "Cannot search an empty tree." << endl;
00302         }
00303         else
00304         {
00305                 // Tree is not empty...
00306 
00307                 current = this->root;
00308 
00309                 while(   (current != 0) && !(found)   )
00310                 {
00311                         // Keep searching...
00312 
00313                         // Get the search key for the current item
00314                         T currentItem = current->data;
00315 
00316 
00317                         // Not sure how to enforce that T is required to implement Searchable.
00318 
00319                         long itemKey;
00320                         itemKey = currentItem.getKey(); // gets the ISBN value from the BookType or BookLoan object.
00321 
00322                         // Compare key
00323                         if (itemKey == searchKey)
00324                         {
00325                                 // Found at this node.
00326                                 // Replace node data
00327                                 current->data = nodeData;
00328                                 found = true;
00329                         }
00330                         else if (itemKey > searchKey)
00331                         {
00332                                 // Search left subtree
00333                                 current = current->left;
00334                         }
00335                         else
00336                         {
00337                                 // Search right subtree
00338                                 current = current->right;
00339                         }
00340                 }       // end while
00341         }               // end else
00342 
00343         return found;
00344 }

00362 bool BinarySearchTree<T>::searchByKey(const long & searchKey) const
00363 {

00365         bool found = false;
00366 
00367         if (this->root == 0)
00368         {
00369                 cout << "Cannot search an empty tree." << endl;

00374

00378                 {

00380 
00381                         // Get the search key for the current item
00382                         T currentItem = current->data;
00383 
00384 
00385                         // Not sure how to enforce that T is required to implement Searchable.
00386 
00387                         long itemKey;
00388                         itemKey = currentItem.getKey(); // gets the ISBN value from the BookType or BookLoan object.
00389 
00390                         // Compare key
00391                         if (itemKey == searchKey)
00392                         {
00393                                 // Found at this node.
00394                                 found = true;
00395                         }

00428 template <class T>
00429 bool BinarySearchTree<T>::search(const T& searchItem) const
00430 {
00431         nodeType<T> * current;
00432         bool found = false;
00433 
00434         if (this->root == 0)
00435         {
00436                 cout << "Cannot search an empty tree." << endl;
00437         }
00438         else
00439         {
00440                 // Tree is not empty...
00441 
00442                 current = this->root;
00443 
00444                 while(   (current != 0) && !(found)   )
00445                 {
00446                         // Keep searching...
00447 
00448                         if (current->data == searchItem)
00449                         {
00450                                 // Found at this node.
00451                                 found = true;
00452                         }
00453                         else if (current->data > searchItem)
00454                         {
00455                                 // Search left subtree
00456                                 current = current->left;
00457                         }
00458                         else
00459                         {
00460                                 // Search right subtree
00461                                 current = current->right;
00462                         }
00463                 }       // end while
00464         }               // end else
00465 
00466         return found;
00467 }

00490 template <class T>
00491 void BinarySearchTree<T>::insert(const T & dataToInsert)
00492 {
00493         nodeType<T> * current;                  // pointer to traverse the tree.
00494         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;             // pointer to follow current.
00495         nodeType<T> * newNode;                  // pointer to create the node.
00496 
00497         newNode = new nodeType<T>;
00498         newNode->data = dataToInsert;
00499         newNode->left = 0;
00500         newNode->right = 0;
00501 
00502         if(this->root == 0)
00503         {
00504                 // Tree is currently empty. Make this new item the root of the tree.
00505                 this->root = newNode;
00506 
00507                 // done
00508         }
00509         else
00510         {
00511                 current = this->root; // Start at the root of the tree.
00512                 while(current != 0)
00513                 {
00514                         trailCurrent = current;
00515 
00516                         if(current->data == dataToInsert)
00517                         {
00518                                 cout << "The item to be inserted is already\n in the tree. Duplicates are not allowed!" << endl;
00519                                 return;
00520                                 // done
00521                         }
00522                         else if (current->data > dataToInsert)
00523                         {
00524                                 // Follow left subtree
00525                                 current = current->left;
00526                         }
00527                         else
00528                         {
00529                                 // Follow right subtree
00530                                 current = current->right;
00531                         }
00532                 }               // end while.
00533 
00534                 // current is now NULL. We have found the place to insert at.
00535                 // trailCurrent is the parent of this NULL.
00536 
00537                 if (trailCurrent->data > dataToInsert)
00538                 {
00539                         // Make the new node the LEFT child of trailCurrent.
00540                         trailCurrent->left = newNode;
00541                 }
00542                 else
00543                 {
00544                         // Make the new node the RIGHT child of trailCurrent.
00545                         trailCurrent->right = newNode;
00546                 }
00547         }
00548 }

00551 
00559 template <class T>
00560 void BinarySearchTree<T>::deleteFromTree(nodeType<T> * & p)
00561 {
00562         nodeType<T> * temp;                     // pointer to delete the node.
00563         nodeType<T> * predecessor;      // pointer used in CASE 4.
00564         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;     // pointer behind predecessor.
00565 
00566         if (p == 0)
00567         {
00568                 cout << "Error: the node to be deleted is NULL." << endl;
00569         }
00570         else if(p->left == 0 && p->right == 0)
00571         {
00572 
00573                 // CASE 1
00574                 // Node to be deleted has no right or left subtree.
00575                 // Go ahead and delete the node.
00576                 temp = p;
00577                 p = 0;
00578                 delete temp;
00579         }
00580         else if(p->left == 0)
00581         {
00582 
00583                 // CASE 2
00584                 // Node to be deleted has no left subtree.
00585                 // Bypass and then delete.
00586                 temp = p;
00587                 p = temp->right; // Bypass.
00588                 delete temp;
00589         }
00590         else if(p->right == 0)
00591         {
00592 
00593                 // CASE 3
00594                 // Node to be deleted has no right subtree.
00595                 // Bypass and then delete.
00596                 temp = p;
00597                 p = temp->left; // Bypass.
00598                 delete temp;
00599         }
00600         else
00601         {
00602 
00603                 // CASE 4
00604                 // Node to be deleted has left and right subtrees.
00605                 // Find the predecessor of the node to be deleted...
00606 
00607                 // Go left.
00608                 predecessor = p->left;
00609                 trailCurrent = 0;
00610 
00611                 // Go right until null.
00612                 while (predecessor->right != 0)
00613                 {
00614                         trailCurrent = predecessor;
00615                         predecessor = predecessor->right;
00616                 }
00617 
00618                 //   predecessor->right == NULL
00619 
00620                 //   Overwrite the data of the node to be deleted,
00621                 //   "swapping" in the data of the predecessor.
00622                 p->data = predecessor->data; // Perform the "swap"
00623 
00624 
00625 
00626                 // Bypass the predecessor.
00627                 if (trailCurrent == 0)
00628                 {
00629                         // predecessor did not move.
00630                         // predecessor == p->left.
00631                         // we need to adjust p.
00632 
00633                         p -> left = predecessor -> left; // bypass predecessor
00634                 }
00635                 else
00636                 {
00637                         // predecessor has no right subtree.
00638                         // Get the left subtree of predecessor (might be NULL anyway. Does not matter)
00639                         // ...call it LS
00640                         // Set the right subtree of trailCurrent to LS.
00641                         // predecessor has now been bypassed.
00642 
00643                         trailCurrent->right = predecessor->left; // bypass predecessor
00644                 }
00645 
00646                 // Predecessor has been bypassed.
00647                 // Delete the predecessor.
00648 
00649                 delete predecessor;
00650                 predecessor = 0;
00651         }
00652 }
00653

00656 
00665 template <class T>
00666 void BinarySearchTree<T>::deleteNode(const T & deleteItem)
00667 {
00668         nodeType<T> * current;          // pointer to traverse the tree.
00669         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;     // pointer behind current.
00670 
00671         bool found = false;
00672 
00673         if (this->root == 0)
00674         {
00675                 // Tree is empty.
00676                 cout << "Cannot delete from an empty tree." << endl;
00677         }
00678         else
00679         {
00680                 // Tree is not empty.
00681 
00682                 current = this->root;
00683                 trailCurrent = this->root;
00684 
00685                 while
00686                 (
00687                                  current != 0
00688                                         &&
00689                                 !found
00690                 )
00691                 {
00692                         if (current -> data == deleteItem)
00693                         {
00694                                 // Found the item at this node.
00695                                 found = true;
00696                         }
00697                         else
00698                         {
00699                                 // Not equal to this node.
00700                                 // Search one of the subtrees of this node...
00701 
00702                                 trailCurrent = current;
00703 
00704                                 if (current -> data > deleteItem)
00705                                 {
00706                                         // (Current-> data) > (deleteItem)
00707                                         // Search the left subtree for deleteItem
00708                                         current = current -> left;
00709                                 }
00710                                 else
00711                                 {
00712                                         // (Current-> data) <= (deleteItem)
00713                                         // Search the right subtree for deleteItem
00714                                         current = current -> right;
00715                                 }
00716                         }
00717                 }
00718 
00719                 // current becomes null when we reach the end of a subtree without finding the item.
00720                 // found becomes true when we find the item.
00721 
00722 
00723                 if (current == 0)
00724                 {
00725                         // Searched the whole tree. Did not find the item.
00726                         cout << "The item to be deleted is not in the tree." << endl;
00727                 }
00728                 else if(found)
00729                 {
00730                         // Found the item in the tree.
00731 
00732                         if (current == this->root)
00733                         {
00734                                 // The item is at the root node of the tree.
00735                                 deleteFromTree(this->root);
00736                         }
00737                         else if (trailCurrent -> data > deleteItem)
00738                         {
00739                                 // The item was found in the tree, not at the root.
00740                                 // Current node is the LEFT subnode of trailCurrent
00741                                 deleteFromTree(trailCurrent->left); // delete current
00742                         }
00743                         else
00744                         {
00745                                 // The item was found in the tree, not at the root.
00746                                 // Current node is the RIGHT subnode of trailCurrent
00747                                 deleteFromTree(trailCurrent->right); // delete current
00748                         }
00749                 }
00750                 else
00751                 {
00752                         // How can this happen?  (found == true)  &&  (current != 0)
00753                         cout << "How can this happen? The item to be deleted is not in the tree." << endl;
00754                 }
00755         }
00756 }

00768 {
00769         fillVectorInOrder(vect, this->root);
00770 }

00812 template <class T>
00813 void BinarySearchTree<T>::fillVectorInOrder(vector<T> & vect, nodeType<T> * p) const
00814 {
00815         if (p != 0)
00816         {
00817                 fillVectorInOrder(vect, p->left);
00818                 //cout << p->data.getKey() << endl;
00819                 vect.push_back(p->data);                        // process me in the middle.
00820                 fillVectorInOrder(vect, p->right);
00821         }
00822 }
00823 
00824 
00825 
00835 template <class T>
00836 void BinarySearchTree<T>::fillVectorPreOrder(vector<T> & vect, nodeType<T> * p) const
00837 {
00838         if (p != NULL)
00839         {
00840                 vect.push_back(p->data);                        // process me first
00841                 fillVectorPreOrder(vect, p->left);
00842                 fillVectorPreOrder(vect, p->right);
00843         }
00844 }
00845 
00846 
00847 
00848 
00858 template <class T>
00859 void BinarySearchTree<T>::fillVectorPostOrder(vector<T> & vect, nodeType<T> * p) const
00860 {
00861         if (p != NULL)
00862         {
00863                 fillVectorPostOrder(vect, p->left);
00864                 fillVectorPostOrder(vect, p->right);
00865                 vect.push_back(p->data);                        // process me last
00866         }
00867 }
